https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/891#issuecomment-366511279
Exactly what I was thinking. You keep saying it *needs* to be in the App Store, almost aggressively, but iOS allows for signing applications outside of the App Store, for free, or paid, depending.

The mentioned tool, Cydia Impactor, would work for free.
TweakBox (Signig Services in General) are paid for by the Signing Service, so it would be free for the end user.

(I can test by the way)
